page.title: 17ENTERTAINMENT IN WELWYN
page.content: Harpsichord Camerata is an instru_ mental ensemble specialising in the performance of Baroque music and has the 18th century ensemble tradition of Flute, Oboe, Violin, Violoncello and Harpsichord with occasional Bassoon. The group is Welwyn based and was founded in 1973 by Robert Gould who has been its director ever since. Harpsichord Camerata give approx 12 concerts each year to the benefit of a number of charities. Concerts are generally but not exclusively given in and around Hertfordshire. 6 years ago a Welwyn based chamber orchestra was formed in which all the players from Harpsichord Camerata are joined by another 10 instrumentalists. It has the name of the Camerata Orchestra and has become well known in Herts for performances of music from late 16th to 20th century.
